cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 45 miles W of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the eastern Gulf of Mexico, expected to slow, turn north, and approach the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi coast) late Monday into Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the mouth of the Mississippi River (southeast Louisiana) late Monday night or Tuesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Grand Isle, Louisiana to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas (metropolitan New Orleans area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through coastal Mississippi and Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (39–73 mph) are likely at the port as early as Monday; hurricane-force gusts are possible on Tuesday if Sally strengthens and tracks slightly west of forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Peak surge 6–9 ft possible from the mouth of the Mississippi River eastward, which includes Plaquemines Parish shoreline and port facilities.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches with isolated totals up to 18 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large waves and dangerous rip currents on approaches, possible river flooding on the lower Mississippi, and brief tornadoes in outer rainbands.
